Detailed Description

JMA_CType_UTF8 gives the character type information in UTF-8 encoding.

Member Function Documentation

unsigned int jma::JMA_CType_UTF8::getByteCount ( const char *  p  )  const [virtual]

Get the byte count of the first character pointed by p, which character is in a specific encoding.

In UTF-8, characters from the U+0000..U+10FFFF range (the UTF-16 accessible range) are encoded using sequences of 1 to 4 octets.

Parameters:
p pointer to the character string
Returns:
the count of bytes.

The table below summarizes the format of these different octet types. The letter x indicates bits available for encoding bits of the character number.

Char. number range | UTF-8 octet sequence (hexadecimal) | (binary) --------------------+--------------------------------------------- 0000 0000-0000 007F | 0xxxxxxx 0000 0080-0000 07FF | 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx 0000 0800-0000 FFFF | 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 0001 0000-0010 FFFF | 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx

Implements jma::JMA_CType.

Definition at line 52 of file jma_ctype_utf8.cpp.

bool jma::JMA_CType_UTF8::isSpace ( const char *  p  )  const [virtual]

Check whether is white-space character.

White-space characters are " \t\n\v\f\r", and also space character in specific encoding.

Parameters:
p pointer to the character string
Returns:
true for white-space character, false for non white-space character.
Attention:
UTF-8 byte-order mark (0xEF 0xBB 0xBF) is also assumed as white-space character.

Implements jma::JMA_CType.
